evidence: Suppose the impulse response of the system is a delta function.
The Fourier transform of a delta function is a constant.
From the convolution theorem, we also know...
Only sinusoids have this amazing property...
That’s what makes them so special in Fourier analysis.
Well, we know that the Fourier transform of a delta function is a constant - it's just one everywhere.
triples.s: Fourier transform of a delta function

concepts.term: o of t equals alpha times i of t.
